Description: Rim and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of early Chian patterned pottery chalice, with part of cul; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black (fired reddish) below; traces of added white bands; exterior: reserved save for narrow black line on edge of rim, brown line at top of cul and, at bottom left, part of double saw-edged metope pattern; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 29)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0342) (phase 2)
